column4: how can I get a list of supported FSs from the console (like shown in gparted)?
there used to be a cat /proc/filesystems
that should show all fs's the kernel supports. I think
thanks It's missing a few but it's close.
i seem to recall that one being special..its like a subset of vfat? I cant rember the details..
theres dozens of fuse thigs :) its an amazing tool. but im not even sure what exfat is for.
its ntfs-3g i thought these days. Its possible ythat list is Not showing the modules for fs's you can load.
exfat is the replacement for FAT32 it's supported by win, mac, and linux
i thought that was vfat.. or am i getting confused again. :)
i seem tobe accessing a HPFS/NTFS/exFAT filesystem just fine. (from what sudo fdisk -l) calls my windows partition. :)
vfat is fat32 with long names still limited to 2 TB
but i bet its because of the way ntfs-3g works with fuse..
seems searching $PATH for mk* is the best option so far~
